meanings.definition: To make use of something again.
meanings.sent1: After finishing his sandwich, he reavailed the delicious cookies on the table.
meanings.sent2: She reavailed her old bicycle when she decided to start cycling again.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel reavailed the same hiding spot for its acorns, fooling the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The wise old owl reavailed its knowledge of the forest to guide the lost travelers.
meanings.sent5: The young artist reavailed her favorite paintbrush to create a masterpiece.

meanings.sent2: The cunning fox reavailed the distraction to sneak into the henhouse.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat reavailed the open window to explore the neighbor's yard.
